intro: Epilobium flavescens, commonly known as yellow willow herb, is a flowering plant in the Onagraceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist habitats such as stream banks and wet meadows. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Epilobium flavescens is typically herbaceous, with a creeping or upright growth habit depending on environmental conditions.
